Fwd: EHCP for Gwen Vials Moore
events: ukSubject:EHCP for Gwen Vials Moore﻿Hi TherePlease find attached our track changed EHCP and the parent / person profile for Gwen
The table needed updating generally owing to Gwen's progress

Apologies for the delays that these very difficult times have causedNote that without ever having sight of the draft for submission and with such a long gap in time between professional evaluation and subsequent input into the document (Gwen will have spent 7 months home learning by the time she returns to school in September), we will not be supporting it and would instead prefer a full formal review, feeding into an informed update with new health / assessments as soon as possible in the new term to cover this important statutory document
As discussed on the phone Gwen is due an Ed Psych review

title: Fwd: Gwen - letter
events: com>Subject:RE: Gwen - letter﻿HiPlease find attached the flight letter for GwenKind regardsJanice-----Original Message-----From: Adam Vials Moore moore
com>Subject: Gwen - letter and oxygen nurseHi Janice

Well - that was an "exciting" time last nightFirst of all thank you so much for everyone for arranging everything so quicklyObviously not quite what we were hoping for but on we goWe'd be so grateful if the letter from Dr Halfhide could be sent to both Cora and myself asap this morning to allow us to deal with the providers and also contact from the oxygen nurse as Phil said last night - we're completely on new territory as Claire has always said oxygen for Gwen is hospital only so don't have the usual network / knowledge

title: Gwen care plans / reports
events: Have you spoken to Gwen’s EHCP lead about these proposed changes (apologies if daft question)
com>Subject:Gwen Vials Moore - support needsHi LauraWe have just had the annual EHCP review meeting with school

Before the meeting formally started, school informed us that, without prior consultation or seeking of views, they intended to remove Gwen’s 121 provision because they are creating a hub with one specialist teacher and two teaching assistants to 8 or more students
We're really concerned about this change - especially as it was planned without input from either medics nor ourselves

Her behaviours are fundamentally unsafe and she requires 1:1 supervision at all times - in fact she gets social care provision for a 2:1 at home (50 hours a week at a higher hourly rate which is almost unheard of)

Gwen was discharged against medical advice (owing to hoist provision), but with medical support, because she was better at home, although her behaviours are difficult everywhere she is better in routine

As an outpatient She went through several cast changes, opened her wound with her fingernail, snapped her brace and the new brace which was fitted yesterday is also now broken and we are currently trying to get hold of orthotics again
Gwen does not care about pain and will inflict it on herself in a sensory seeking manner and will not report it
Given you and your teams support on her recent admissions and awareness of her behaviour, we hoped you could provide a short report / update recommending continued 1:1 provision
